abstract.p: The Fuzzy Match component uses Levenshtein Distance Ratio to determine the similarity between two character sequences. It suggests if there is a match based on the difference between Levenshtein Distance Ratio and the threshold that the user specified.

The component offers two matching modes:
File to File: fuzzy-match columns from two separate files
File to String: fuzzy-match a column of a file to a string

info.description: This component uses Levenshtein Distance Ratio to determine the similarity between two character sequences. It suggests if there is a match based on the difference between Levenshtein Distance Ratio and the threshold that the user specified. The component accepts two matching modes: File to File and File to String.

inputs.p: For File to File mode: Two text files (CSV or tab-delimited) are required.
For File to String mode: One text file (CSV or tab-delimited) is required.

options.p:
For File to File mode:
Threshold: an integer between 40 and 95.
Number of Columns to Match: integer 1 to 4.
File 1 Column X (1-4) to Match: pick a column from the first input file for matching
File 2 Column X (1-4) to Match: pick a column from the second input file for matching

For File to String mode:
Threshold: an integer between 40 and 95.
Column to Match: pick a column from the input file for matching
String to Match: non-empty string for matching
See demo workflow for a File to File match and a File to String match.
